method.name: Enable
method.tp:docstring: Enable or disables the modem. When enabled, the modem's radio is powered on and data sessions, voice calls, location services, and Short Message Service may be available. When disabled, the modem enters low-power state and no network-related operations are available.

arg.name: enable
arg.tp:docstring: Pass True to enable the modem, or False to disable it.

method.name: ListBearers
method.tp:docstring: List configured packet data bearers (EPS Bearers, PDP Contexts, or CDMA2000 Packet Data Sessions).

arg.name: bearers
arg.tp:docstring: The list of bearer object paths.

method.name: CreateBearer
method.tp:docstring: Create a new packet data bearer using the given characteristics. This request may fail if the modem does not support additional bearers, if too many bearers are already defined, or if properties are invalid.

arg.name: properties
arg.tp:docstring:
List of properties to assign to the bearer after creating it. Some properties are only applicable to a bearer of certain access technologies, for example the "apn" property is not applicable to CDMA2000 Packet Data Session bearers. Allowed properties are:
apn : (3GPP, required) Access Point Name ip-type : (3GPP and CMDA, optional) Addressing type, one of "IPV4", "IPV4V6", or "IPV6" user : (3GPP, optional) user name (if any) required by the network password : (3GPP, optional) password (if any) required by the network number : (POTS, required) telphone number to dial
** FIXME: how about QoS?

arg.name: path
arg.tp:docstring: On success, the object path of the newly created bearer.

method.name: DeleteBearer
method.tp:docstring: Delete an existing packet data bearer.

arg.name: bearer
arg.tp:docstring: Object path of the bearer to delete. If the bearer is currently active and providing packet data server, it will be disconnected and that packet data service will terminate.

method.name: Reset
method.tp:docstring: Clear non-persistent configuration and state, and return the device to a newly-powered-on state. This command may power-cycle the device.

method.name: FactoryReset
method.tp:docstring: Clear the modem's configuration (including persistent configuration and state), and return the device to a factory-default state. This command may or may not power-cycle the device.
method.arg: Carrier-supplied code required to reset the modem. Ignored if not required.

method.name: SetAllowedModes
method.tp:docstring: Set the access technologies (eg 2G/3G/4G preference) the device is currently allowed to use when connecting to a network.

arg.name: allowed
arg.tp:docstring: Bitmask of all the modes allowed in the modem.

arg.name: preferred
arg.tp:docstring: Specific mode preferred among the ones allowed, if any.

method.name: SetAllowedBands
method.tp:docstring: Set the radio frequency and technology bands the device is currently allowed to use when connecting to a network.

arg.name: mode
arg.tp:docstring: Bitmask of all the bands allowed in the modem.

signal.name: StateChanged
signal.tp:docstring: The modem's state (see the State property) changed.

property.name: Sim
property.tp:docstring: The path of the SIM object available in this device, if any.

property.name: ModemCapabilities
property.tp:docstring: The generic family of access technologies the modem supports. Not all capabilities are available at the same time however; some modems require a firmware reload or other reinitialization to switch between eg CDMA/EVDO and GSM/UMTS.

property.name: CurrentCapabilities
property.tp:docstring: The generic family of access technologies the modem currently supports without a firmware reload or reinitialization.

property.name: MaxBearers
property.tp:docstring: The maximum number of defined packet data bearers the modem supports. This is not the number of active/connected bearers the modem supports, but simply the number of bearers that may be defined at any given time. For example, POTS and CDMA2000-only devices support only one bearer, while GSM/UMTS devices typically support three or more, and any LTE-capable device (whether LTE-only, GSM/UMTS-capable, and/or CDMA2000-capable) also typically support three or more.

property.name: MaxActiveBearers
property.tp:docstring: The maximum number of active packet data bearers the modem supports. POTS and CDMA2000-only devices support one active bearer, while GSM/UMTS and LTE-capable devices (including LTE/CDMA devices) typically support at least two active bearers.

property.name: Manufacturer
property.tp:docstring: The equipment manufacturer, as reported by the modem.

property.name: Model
property.tp:docstring: The equipment model, as reported by the modem.

property.name: Revision
property.tp:docstring: The revision identification of the software, as reported by the modem.

property.name: DeviceIdentifier
property.tp:docstring: A best-effort device identifier based on various device information like model name, firmware revision, USB/PCI/PCMCIA IDs, and other properties. This ID is not guaranteed to be unique and may be shared between identical devices with the same firmware, but is intended to be "unique enough" for use as a casual device identifier for various user experience operations. This is not the device's IMEI or ESN since those may not be available before unlocking the device via a PIN.

property.name: Device
property.tp:docstring: The physical modem device reference (ie, USB, PCI, PCMCIA device), which may be dependent upon the operating system. In Linux for example, this points to a sysfs path of the usb_device object.

property.name: Driver
property.tp:docstring: The Operating System device driver handling communication with the modem hardware.

property.name: Plugin
property.tp:docstring: The name of the plugin handling this modem.

property.name: EquipmentIdentifier
property.tp:docstring: The identity of the device. This will be the IMEI number for GSM devices and the hex-format ESN/MEID for CDMA devices.

property.name: UnlockRequired
property.tp:docstring: Empty if the device is usable without an unlock code or has already been unlocked. If the device needs to be unlocked before becoming usable this property contains the specific unlock code required. Valid unlock code values are "" (blank), "sim-pin", "sim-puk", "ph-sim-pin", "ph-fsim-pin", "ph-fsim-puk", "sim-pin2", "sim-puk2", "ph-net-pin", "ph-net-puk", "ph-netsub-pin", "ph-netsub-puk", "ph-sp-pin", "ph-sp-puk", "ph-corp-pin", and "ph-corp-puk".

property.name: UnlockRetries
property.tp:docstring: The number of unlock retries remaining for the unlock code given by the property UnlockRequired, or 999 if the device does not support reporting unlock retries.

property.name: State
property.tp:docstring: Overall state of the modem.

property.name: AccessTechnology
property.tp:docstring: The current network access technology used by the device to communicate with the network. (Note to plugin writers: if the device's access technology cannot be determined, use UNKNOWN)

property.name: SignalQuality
property.tp:docstring: Signal quality in percent (0 - 100) of the dominant access technology the device is using to communicate with the network. Always 0 for POTS devices. The additional boolean value indicates if the quality value given was recently taken.

property.name: AllowedModes
property.tp:docstring: The access technologies (eg 2G/3G/4G preference) the device is currently allowed to use when connecting to a network. For POTS devices, only the "any" mode is supported.

property.name: PreferredMode
property.tp:docstring: The preferred access technology (eg 2G/3G/4G), among the ones defined in the allowed modes. Only one or none values must be given.

property.name: SupportedModes
property.tp:docstring: Access technology selection modes supported by the device. For POTS devices, only the "any" mode will be returned.

property.name: AllowedBands
property.tp:docstring: The radio frequency and technology bands the device is currently allowed to use when connecting to a network. For POTS devices, only the "any" value is supported.

property.name: SupportedBands
property.tp:docstring: Radio frequency and technology bands supported by the device. For POTS devices, only the "any" value will be returned.

tp:flags.name: MM_MODEM_CAPABILITIES
tp:flags.tp:docstring: Flags describing one or more of the general access technology families that a modem supports.

tp:flag.tp:docstring: Modem supports the analog wired telephone network (ie 56k dialup) and does not have wireless/cellular capabilities.
Modem supports at least one of CDMA 1xRTT, EVDO revision 0, EVDO revision A, or EVDO revision B.
Modem supports at least one of GSM, GPRS, EDGE, UMTS, HSDPA, HSUPA, or HSPA+ packet switched data capability.
Modem has LTE Advanced data capability.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The modem is not enabled and is powered down.
The modem is current transitioning to the DISABLED state.
The modem is currently transitioning to the ENABLED state.
The modem is enabled and powered on but not registered with a network provider and not available for data connections.
The modem is searching for a network provider to register with.
The modem is registered with a network provider, and data connections and messaging may be available for use.

The modem is disconnecting and deactivating the last active packet data bearer. This state will not be entered if more than one packet data bearer is active and one of the active bearers is deactivated.
The modem is activating and connecting the first packet data bearer. Subsequent bearer activations when another bearer is already active do not cause this state to be entered.
One or more packet data bearers is active and connected.
State change was requested by an interface user.
State change was caused by a system suspend.

tp:enum.name: MM_MODEM_ACCESS_TECH
tp:enum.tp:docstring: Describes various access technologies that a device uses when registered with or connected to a network.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The access technology used is unknown

tp:enum.name: MM_MODEM_MODE
tp:enum.tp:docstring: Bitfield to indicate which access modes are supported, allowed or preferred in a given device.

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: Any mode can be used (only this value allowed for POTS modems)

tp:flags.name: MM_MODEM_BAND
tp:flags.tp:docstring: A 64-bit wide bitfield describing the specific radio bands supported by the device and the radio bands the device is allowed to use when connecting to a mobile network.

tp:flag.tp:docstring: For certain operations, allow the modem to select a band automatically.
CDMA Band Class 17 (US 2500MHz Forward Link Only)
